Title: The test of humanity during the covid-19 situation in indonesia
Source title: European Journal of Molecular and Clinical Medicine
Affiliations: Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Princes, E., Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiwan, T.I., Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The history has shown that during dangerous situation, people seek for their own safety. However, the example shown from the Covid-19 quick anticipation in Wuhan, China has shown the exact opposite. The researcher tries to identify human behaviors during the pandemic situation of Covid-19 in Indonesia. The researcher argues that compared to other countries, Indonesian people have different characteristics and responses. They are more self-centered and judgmental. Using the qualitative approach, the researcher classifies the people into 4 groups during a pandemic situation with two main groups as the research priority. First, the egocentric group as the group dominating the food and medical supplies. The panic buying in Indonesia causes this group of people to pile up stocks at home and cause the retail price to rocket. The second group is the profit-seeking group who takes advantage of this situation and sells the important food and medical supply in high price. The four groups represent the chaotic society culture in Indonesia and are the main reasons for questions if the humanity still exists. This research gives an understanding to the government to face the next pandemic if it happens someday. There are two limitations. First, at the time this research is made, the Covid-19 pandemic is still ongoing. There is a high possibility that a new group might appear near or at the end of the pandemic. Second, this paper does not separate the people into groups of different income levels, age groups and gender. Future research should address these limitations. © 2020 Ubiquity Press. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Corona virus; Covid-19; Egocentric; Humanity; Pandemic; Profit-seeking

Authors: Indartoyo I.M., Purwanto B.M., Budiwan T.I.
Title: Conceptual Paper of Eye Tracker Study in Online Impulsive Buying Research
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: International Marketing Program, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Ina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics and Business, Gadjah Mada University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Indartoyo, I.M., International Marketing Program, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Ina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Purwanto, B.M., Faculty of Economics and Business, Gadjah Mada University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Budiwan, T.I., International Marketing Program, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Ina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Impulsive buying is viewed as behaviour influenced by external and internal stimuli. The impulsive buying behaviour resulted in a swift buying decision. This study describes previous studies on how impulsive buying would benefit the companies. Therefore, companies are trying to understand what would induce impulsive buying towards their products. Capturing the behaviour requires some tools such as an eye tracker. This article collects the latest impulsive buying studies. Methods and tools used are explained in the articles. The last part of the article discusses future research to be conducted on online impulsive buying. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: external stimulus and online impulsive buying; eye-tracker; internal stimulus
Index Keywords: Information management; Buying behaviour; Buying decisions; External stimulus; Eye trackers; internal stimulus; Eye tracking

Authors: Indartoyo I.M., Noviyana N., Budiwan T.I., Sadeghifam A.
Title: Analysing how Indonesian viewers choose their favourite talk show programmes
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University (BINUS), Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Civil Engineering, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia (UTM), Kuala Lumpur, 54100, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Indartoyo, I.M., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University (BINUS), Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Noviyana, N., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University (BINUS), Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Budiwan, T.I., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University (BINUS), Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Sadeghifam, A., Faculty of Civil Engineering, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia (UTM), Kuala Lumpur, 54100, Malaysia
Abstract: This study adopted a mix research methodology to analyse factors influencing Indonesians’ choice of talk show programme. It found themes, timing of the programme, the actors’ performances and the appropriateness of the show were the main factors. Additionally, interests, value of entertainment if it was inspirational and informative, language used, duration of advertisement, presenter, guests, content and the influence of social groups (friends and family) played a role. These can be categorised as sensibility, contentment, fondness, and suitability. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Factor analysis; Indonesian television viewers; Talk show programme

Authors: Melati I., Budiwan T.I., Sarjono H.
Title: The influence of celebrity endorsement on consumer's attitude: A study case of smartphone brands in Jakarta, Indonesia
Source title: International Journal of Engineering and Technology(UAE)
Affiliations: Management Department BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Melati, I., Management Department BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiwan, T.I., Management Department BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sarjono, H., Management Department BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study analyzes the effect of celebrity endorsement on consumer's attitude towards social media advertising as well as the effect of consumer's attitude towards social media advertising on consumer's purchase intention of smartphone brands in Jakarta. A survey was conducted on 404 university students in Bina Nusantara University. After conducting exploratory factor analysis (EFA) and multipleregression analysis, the result indicates that consumer's attitude towards social media advertising is positively affected by 4 factors: celebrity trustworthiness, celebrity liking, celebrity match-up with product and celebrity familiarity. Attitude towards social media advertising also has a positive impact on consumer's purchase intention of smartphone brands in Jakarta. © 2018 Authors.
Author Keywords: Celebrity endorsement; Consumer's attitude towards social media advertising; Purchase intention; Smartphone brands
References: Arora, A., Celebrity Endorsement: an Effective Marketing Tool (2013) International Journal of Management Prudence, 5 (2), pp. 27-32; Boateng, H., Okoe, A.F., Determinants of Consumers' Attitude towards Social Media Advertising (2015) Journal of Creative Communications, 10 (3), pp. 248-258. , https://doi.org/10.1177/0973258615614417; Chan, K., Leung, N.Y., Luk, E.K., Impact of celebrity endorsement in advertising on brand image among Chinese adolescents (2013) Young Consumers, 14 (2), pp. 167-179. , https://doi.org/10.1108/17473611311325564; Indonesian Smartphone Brands in a Hard Fight as Local Competition Intensifies (2017) IDC Reports [WWW Document]. Authors: Indartoyo I.M., Rahayu E., Budiwan T.I., Bismo A., Sadeghifam A.N.
Title: A consumer behaviour investigation in search engine utilization through behavioural segmentation approach
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Faculty of Engineering, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Indartoyo, I.M., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Rahayu, E., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Budiwan, T.I., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bismo, A., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sadeghifam, A.N., Faculty of Engineering, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Abstract: This paper studies explores web search behavior among procurement officers based on their profile in playing online game. By understanding how people search, companies will better target their market through better suited contents in blogs, websites and social media. The study was conducted using in-depth interview and observation. The data was collected using purposive sampling method, then analyzed using content analysis. The research concluded 1) a segmentation based on their behaviour in playing online games (gamers segmentation); 2) search behaviour patterns based on the gamers segmentations. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: behavioural segmentation; Gamers segmentation; search engine; web search behavior
Index Keywords: Information management; Information retrieval; Search engines; Social networking (online); Websites; Content analysis; In-depth interviews; On-line games; People searches; Sampling method; Search behaviours; Social media; Web search behavior; Human computer interaction
